Response.Subject: KNIFE
Response.Text: The man who lived here, he went mad, smashed his chair, and left.

Response.Subject: CANDLE
Response.Text: I don't remember what he looked like. He was tall. I remember a chair.

Response.Subject: PEN
Response.Text: There was anger, lots of shouting, and the howling and breaking.

Response.Subject: DESK
Response.Text: If only everything had been left as it was, my love wouldn't be in pieces!

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: Can't you leave me alone? I've already suffered enough!

Response.Subject: LOGS
Response.Text: He broke it, can't you see!? He broke it and now he's left us all!

Question.Text: Do you know why he would destroy a chair?

Response.Subject: KNIFE
Response.Text: I remember it was important to him. I think I made the chair? Was he mad at me?

Response.Subject: CANDLE
Response.Text: I really don't. I couldn't see what hapPENed, but I wouldn't remember anyway.

Response.Subject: PEN
Response.Text: Well, the chair was a gift, but it made him sad. Then his sadness turned to rage.

Response.Subject: DESK
Response.Text: I wish I knew! My poor chair. He made that chair for me you know!

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: Just leave me be, why would you torment me with these questions?

Response.Subject: LOGS
Response.Text: It doesn't matter! He chopped the chair, not us LOGS, he chopped it and we are saved!

Question.Text: I don't understand why a chair would anger someone.

Response.Subject: KNIFE
Response.Text: He never used to be angry, he used to be happy. We would carve, hunt, and cook together.

Response.Subject: CANDLE
Response.Text: I remember seeing two people here. One on the chair. Then it was just one person. Maybe they did something to the chair.

Response.Subject: PEN
Response.Text: It's been quiet for so long... once there was a woman's voice, but it was so gentle it could never have angered him.

Response.Subject: DESK
Response.Text: Why does it even matter. He took my beloved, so selfish of him, so cruel.

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: He used to chop wood, but that wasn't with anger. Then he made me break it, and now I have to live with myself.

Response.Subject: LOGS
Response.Text: We don't either! But he's gone and he took his chopping and his tears and his woman away.

Response.Subject: DESK
Response.Text: Can't you see my chair in ruins? He was so beautiful, and so elegant, he was taken from me only a year ago.

Response.Subject: LOGS
Response.Text: The chair, the stupid, ugly chair.

Question.Text: I'm sorry you are suffering. Please tell me why, perhaps I can do something.

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: It was special, the chair. He made me break it apart. My friends- they judge me for it. And the LOGS, they love it.

Question.Text: Do you know why he left in such a hurry?

Response.Subject: KNIFE
Response.Text: The woman made him leave. We used to hunt together but she didn't like it.

Response.Subject: CANDLE
Response.Text: It was the woman! I remember seeing her, she came, and then she left, and he followed her.

Response.Subject: PEN
Response.Text: The chair would remember, he had such good memory. But I remember he was inconsolable after she left.

Response.Subject: DESK
Response.Text: Oh I don't know, really. My beloved used to talk about him all the time. If only he were still here he could tell you.

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: He wanted a child.

Question.Text: You keep talking about a woman, who is she?

Response.Subject: KNIFE
Response.Text: She must have been special to him, the chair we made was for her.

Response.Subject: CANDLE
Response.Text: They were together for a long time. But I've forgotten her face.

Response.Subject: PEN
Response.Text: He was her husband! I remember writing letters to her now, it was when they were courting. She moved here to be with him.

Response.Subject: DESK
Response.Text: She was good, and kind.

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: Please don't make me remember, it's too painful.

Question.Text: If the chair was a gift, what was it for?

Response.Subject: KNIFE
Response.Text: He said she was beautiful, he wanted to make something beautiful for her. Her face was so full of joy when she saw it.

Response.Subject: CANDLE
Response.Text: I'm not sure, everything is muddled in my mind. I'm so sorry.

Response.Subject: PEN
Response.Text: It was for their wedding. He made it to celebrate her, but it wasn't just for her. It was for a child too.

Question.Text: I need to know, please, maybe I can help you- if you'll let me.

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: Take the LOGS away from me, burn them. I can't forget what hapPENed, but I don't need to be reminded of it at every moment.

Question.Text: There, it's done. They won't bother you any more, will you tell me what hapPENed here now?

Response.Subject: AXE
Response.Text: Yes, the chair was for his wife and child. First he lost her, then he lost his son, it was so terrible. Wait, I can hear him coming, ask him!
